sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has one pair of parallel sides measuring 8 cm and 10 cm, respectively. The non-parallel sides each measure 6 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add the lengths of all four sides.

Perimeter = (first parallel side) + (second parallel side) + (first non-parallel side) + (second non-parallel side)

Perimeter = 8 cm + 10 cm + 6 cm + 6 cm = 30 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 30 cm.
